--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "kvirgilm" <kvm@c...> wrote:
> I am tring to install the cantera source on windows.  I installed 
> numeric python and checked out cantera via cvs.  I ran ./confiugre 
> and everything looked fine.  The configre output said to "Now start 
> Visual Studio, open workspace 'win32/cantera.dsw' and build 
> project 'all'"  I go to Visual Studio, and try to open 
cantera.dsw.  
> The file is there, but nothing happens when I open it.
> 
> 
> Any ideas?

I think I figured out my own problem.  When installing cygwin, I had 
selected "use unix files" instead of "use dos files".  I went back 
and switched this and the the cantera.dsw file came up just fine.
